qas.question: How many public schools are regulated by the 1868 Public Schools Act?
Which type of school requires students to live at the school?
How many all-male boarding schools exist in the UK?
How much does Eton College charge per term?
How does Eton College rate expense-wise with the other HMC boarding schools in the UK?
Which one of the ten English HMC schools is a day school rather than a boarding school?
Which one of the ten English HMC schools is girls only?
What is the most expensive HMC boarding school in the UK?
How many British prime ministers has Radley educated?
How expensive is Harrow per term?

context: <b5_0>Eton<b5_0/> is one of <a0_0>ten<a0_0/> English HMC schools, commonly referred to as "public schools", regulated by the Public Schools Act of 1868. Following the public school tradition, Eton is a full <a1_0>boarding school<a1_0/>, which means all pupils live at the school, and it is one of <a2_0>four<a2_0/> such remaining single-sex boys' public schools in the United Kingdom (the others being <b7_0>Harrow<b7_0/>, <b6_0>Radley<b6_0/>, and Winchester) to continue this practice. Eton has educated <b8_0>19<b8_0/> British prime ministers and generations of the aristocracy and has been referred to as the chief nurse of England's statesmen. Charging <a3_0>up to <b9_0>£11,478<b9_0/><a3_0/> per term (there are three terms per academic year) in 2014/15, Eton is the <a4_0>sixth most expensive<a4_0/> HMC boarding school in the UK.
